using distance field fonts versus the
bit map is bit mapap has to for every
single different size text. It's going
to then add that glyph to this font
atlas. So imagine that you have lots of
text sizes, lots of different languages
being rendered. You're filling up this
atlas all the time. Then there's a hitch
while you reload your atlas. Um all of
that sort of stuff. with uh multi-
channelannel distance field fonts, it's
generally only going to render the
character once and then it can scale to
any amount of size that you have inside
of your game. Um I believe the last time
I looked two years ago on Fortnite, we
had um 9,000 text widgets and like over
200 sizes. So the font atlas could fill
quite quickly on accident. Um so this
has kind of really helped us try to
anticipate that and work through like
how do we support more fonts, more sizes
and that sort of thing. The one um
downside with this and definitely chat
with your technical folks is that since
a single bit map is just a single
channel. So you only have the red
channel here. When you have the multi-
channelannel um distance field fonts you
are going to have then a four
channelneled texture. So, it's a little
bit more in your runtime memory, but it
kind of depends on what you need to
balance and load there. So, that's
